venue.name: Wesleyan Univ. Center for the Arts

item.description:
...without a big stick! Come see traditional Japanese taiko drumming! Some of us may have dinner before. This has replaced the Sunday Iron Man movie Event (which had only 1 "yes" anyway).

TAIKO: Some taiko performances are like a cross between drumming, primal music, martial arts, multiple instruments, and dance. It may include intricate choreography, and various instruments. It will definitely include powerful rhythms that will get into you physically (there's a lot of bass in taiko drumming).

If you've never seen a taiko ensemble, here's a clip of the Wesleyan student group (taught by Masayo Ishigure), here's a clip of a slick group in rehearsal, and here's a trailer for the world-famous Kodo monks.

THE CONCERT: At 8pm in the World Music Hall at the Wesleyan Center for the Arts is the Annual Spring Taiko concert by the Wesleyan student taiko group. Details here.

DINNER: 6pm at an Indian restaurant I always liked up in that area, Haveli India. If you want dinner, put that in your RSVP, we have to have a reservation. 1300 South Main St, Middletown, 860-347-7773

HOST: Jason, cell 203-901-4957

DIRECTIONS: Wesleyan Center for the Arts directions here. Haveli directions here.

If you want to arrange car-pools, chat about the event, etc, click here to visit the thread on the message board
item.name: Sun. 5/4 - You can't beat this!
